abstract: san antonio 's andeavor buys permian basin crude oil infrastructure .
article: san antonio refiner andeavor announced wednesday it will buy crude oil infrastructure in west texas and new mexico for an undisclosed amount of money . the refiner is buying the rangeland energy ii , llc system , which includes storage tanks , a frac sand terminal , and a 67 percent stake in the 110-mile rio pipeline , from sugar land-based midstream developer rangeland energy . san antonio-based midstream venture capital firm encap flatrock midstream financially supported the development of the rangeland energy ii system . encap flatrock midstream has invested at least $ 615 million into rangeland energy projects since rangeland was founded in 2009 .

andeavor spokeswoman destin singleton said the company plans to integrate the rangeland energy ii crude oil infrastructure with its under construction conan crude oil gathering pipeline system . the conan system is a $ 225 million , 130-mile pipeline that will have a capacity of 250,000 barrels of oil a day when completed . singleton would not say how much the purchase would cost andeavor , which expects the deal to close in the first quarter of 2018 . rye druzin is a san antonio express-news energy reporter . read more of his stories here . | rdruzin@express-news . net | @druz_journo .
